definition: to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to break out of a crisis

sentences.english: It is a shortcut to accomplishment and an easy escape from embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 它是走向成功的捷径，也是摆脱困境的妙方。

sentences.english: I'm sure we will twelve-step our way out of the difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 我坚信我们会一步步摆脱困境的。

sentences.english: We would like to get rid of x because it is this dependent variable.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望摆脱x，因为x是一个因变量。

sentences.english: I am just the owner of a small property, getting rid of my unwanted trees.
sentences.chinese: 我只是小业主，摆脱我不需要的树木。

sentences.english: It’s no big deal. I don’t mind helping you out.
sentences.chinese: 这没什么大不了的，我不介意帮助你摆脱困境。

sentences.english: There’s no getting away from it, if you’re Irish.
sentences.chinese: 只要你做了爱尔兰人，你是没法摆脱它的。

sentences.english: Also, I personally want to get rid of the status bar.
sentences.chinese: 此外，我个人想摆脱状态栏。

sentences.english: Billions of young people want to move beyond the shackles of poverty and conflict.
sentences.chinese: 数十亿年轻人想摆脱贫困和冲突的镣铐。

sentences.english: Yet after all this drama, I still can't shake the feelings out of my system.
sentences.chinese: 然而，毕竟这戏，我仍然不能摆脱感情出我的系统。

sentences.english: "Some of the veteran guys were like, "Oh OK, he switched off.
sentences.chinese: “就像老鸟们那样，”哦，他摆脱你了。

sentences.english: Bin Laden daughter hides in Saudi embassy in Iran.
sentences.chinese: 拉登女儿摆脱伊朗软禁，躲入沙特大使馆。

sentences.english: The little ship tried to escape when the big pirate ship bore down on it.
sentences.chinese: 那条大海盗船逐渐逼近时，小船力图摆脱。

sentences.english: They try to find a way out of their dilemma.
Learn how to escape a single wrist grab in this free video on kid's self-defense.
sentences.chinese: 了解如何摆脱在这个免费视频单手腕孩子的自卫抢。

sentences.english: Shed old ideas about who you are and what you're capable of.
sentences.chinese: 摆脱关于你是谁与你能够做什么的旧框框。

sentences.english: By the end of last year, he had wiggled out of the mess.
sentences.chinese: 到去年年底，他已经从困境中摆脱出来。

definition: to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to bind/to restrict/to tie/to commit/fetters
to throw off/to abandon/to cast off/to get rid of/to dump
to reverse/to turn around (an undesirable situation)/(mechanics) torsion
to run away/to escape
shackles/to shackle/(fig.) restraint/yoke
to break/to smash
predicament/plight
to run out/to escape
to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to perplex/to disturb/to cause complications
to leave (a room etc)/to go out through (a door etc)
to abandon/to discard/to spurn/to forsake
to be far from/to keep away from
to dissolve/to resolve (contradictions)/to dispel (doubts)/to iron out (difficulties)/to defuse (conflicts)/to neutralize (fears)
to renounce/to abandon/to give up
